text: Rawal or Ravel is a clan of the Rajput caste based in various north Indian states and Pakistan. ==Origin== Rawal Rajputs claim to be of the Chandravanshi Kshatriya lineage. They are believed to be the descendants of ruler Bappa Rawal of Mewar. Some Rawals of Uttarpradesh are believed to have settled after their ancestors migrated from the Indian state of Rajasthan to other places such as Western Uttarpradesh, Haryana and to other parts of northern India. ==Distribution== They are mostly inhabit in the Indian states of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh (Khanpur), Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, India, Haryana (Rewari, Karnal, Sonipat) and Delhi. ==References== ==Further reading== === Other Books === # Henry Miers Elliot (1869) Memoirs on the History, Folk-lore, and Distribution of the Races of the North Western Provinces of India: Being an Amplified Edition of the Original Supplemental Glossary of Indian Terms: Volume 1 Tr√ºbner & Company. p.99 #Horace Arthur Rose, Sir Denzil Ibbetson, Sir Edward Maclagan (1914) A Glossary of the Tribes and Castes of the Punjab and North-West Frontier Province: Based on the Census Report for the Punjab, 1883: Volume 3 superintendent, Government printing, Punjab. p.330 Category:Ethnic groups in India Category:Ethnic groups in Pakistan Category:Castes
title: Rawal Gujjars
